intro: Bunias brachyptera, commonly known as the short-winged mustard, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard species. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, featuring lobed leaves and small, yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. Its seeds are encased in a dry, segmented fruit called a silique, a characteristic feature of the Brassicaceae family. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
